pkgmetadata.longdescription: Signature Survival Analysis // When multiple Cox proportional hazard models are performed on clinical data (month or year and status) and a set of differential expressions of genes, the results (Hazard risks, z-scores and p-values) can be used to create gene-expression signatures. Weights are calculated using the survival p-values of genes and are utilized to calculate expression values of the signature across the selected genes in all patients in a cohort. A Single or multiple univariate or multivariate Cox proportional hazard survival analyses of the patients in one cohort can be performed by using the gene- expression signature and visualized using our survival plots.
